description: Varenyky are traditional Ukrainian dumplings and are often filled with a savoury potato and onion mix.
name: Potato Varenyky Recipe | Woolworths

recipeInstructions.text: Fill a large pot with water and bring to the boil, add the potatoes and cook for 10-12 minutes until tender and drain well and place back into the pot. Mash until smooth. Heat the oil in a large pan on medium heat and cook the onions for 10-15 minutes until golden. tip the onions and oil into the potato mash and mix well.

Sift the flour into a large bowl, add the salt and pour in 175ml of cold water. Mix well with your hands to form a dough ball and divide into 2 pieces. Cover the piece not in use with a damp tea towel.

Tip the dough onto a floured work surface and knead for 2-3 minutes. Roll out to 1/4 inch thickness. Cut circles of dough with a cookie cutter or large glass and place spoonfuls of potato mix on one side of each circle. Fold over and seal the edges by pinching the sides together.

Repeat with the remaining filling and dough. Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to the boil and cook the dumplings in batches for 3-4 minutes, until they float to the top of the water. Drain well and serve with sour cream.
